description: From Urdu مولوی‎ (maulvi), and its source, Persian مولوی‎ (mowlavi), noun use of Arabic مَوْلَوِيّ‎ (mawlawiyy, “of a lord or master”), ultimately from مَوْلًى‎ (mawlan, “master”). Compare mullah, maulana.

entries.meaning: An imam; a Muslim doctor of law.
(loosely, chiefly South Asia) Any man of learning; a scholar, a teacher of Classical languages.
examples: He had a maulvi and a pandit to teach him Urdu and Hindi.
